snippet: As potential rewards have soared, the tactics and technologies available to inside traders today are more sophisticated and more difficult both to detect and to prove.
abstract: James B Stewart Common Sense column argues that the tactics and technologies available to inside traders today are more sophisticated and more difficult to detect and prove; holds practice remains persistent because it offers far more reward than risk.
lead_paragraph: As potential rewards have soared, the tactics and technologies available to inside traders today are more sophisticated and more difficult both to detect and to prove.

headline.seo: Insider Trading Persists, and Gets Stealthier
headline.main: In a New Era of Insider Trading, It’s Risk vs. Reward Squared
